title: 18th Century Fraktur
content: I am looking for a script that would have been used in Germany (specifically the Hessen-Kassel region) in the last quarter of the 18th century. As I understand it, this would have been some type of Fraktur with the long s and ligatures. Perhaps someone here could point me in the right direction?
author: hessenkassel

comments.content:
Hi, posting this topic in the [General Discussions](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317083857/http:/typophile.com/forum/4) forum might receive more responses.

n.

Luther’sche Fraktur is one of the closest digital fonts you’ll be likely to find. I think that it is based on types from the Luther Foundry in Frankfurt/Main from the 18th century. Frankfurt/Main was a free imperial city-state between Hesse-Kassel and Hesse-Darmstadt, but their types probably traveled outside of town.

MyFonts has two digital versions…  
 [Linotype’s](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317083857/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/luthersche-fraktur/) (the Pro font should have the long s and some ligatures in it) and [Elsner + Flake’s](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317083857/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/neue-luthersche-fraktur/).
